intro: Elionurus royleanus var. niveus, commonly known as the white-flowered elionurus, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in umbels. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
